alert.note: Alert for Mayes; Rogers; Wagoner (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 17 at 12:57PM CDT until July 17 at 1:45PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tulsa has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Rogers County in northeastern Oklahoma... Western Mayes County in northeastern Oklahoma... Northwestern Wagoner County in northeastern Oklahoma... * Until 145 PM CDT. * At 1257 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 3 miles southeast of Oologah, moving southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations in or near the path include... Claremore... Pryor... Owasso... Pryor Creek... Catoosa... Verdigris... Chouteau... Inola... Locust Grove... Salina... Oologah... Adair... Foyil... Sportsmen Acres Community... Taiwah... Tiawah... Mazie... Snowdale State Park... Murphy... Bushyhead... This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 234 and 268. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
